title: Rotating game mode where you spend gold on your minions

Did you play Survival Chaos for Warcraft III?

I have not played WC3

https://cdn.meme.am/cache/instances/folder450/70645450.jpg

> [{quoted}](name=Brascus,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=LFLGtrys,comment-id=00100000,timestamp=2017-05-25T20:20:55.512+0000)
>
> I have not played WC3
> 
> https://cdn.meme.am/cache/instances/folder450/70645450.jpg

Well, it's a legendary game and it is the step after the place where the aeon of strife genre got started, but I won't judge nonetheless. Most of my friends haven't played it.

Anyways, Survival Chaos is a 4 player FFA on a square where each player has base at the middle of each of the sides. The bases send out troops down the middle lane to the center, where everyone clashes, and down each side of the base where the troops will clash along the edges of the square with the adjacent base. Everyone gets a different race and a different special bonus specific to the race at the beginning, and then everyone fights. When your troops kill other troops you get money, which you can use to spend on researches for the units, upgrading your buildings, buying units/heroes, and researching abilities. It's a really cool map.

this sounds like legit fun 

http://imgur.com/aMZvjot.gif?noredirect

Well guess what, there were a couple Command and Conquer maps made for Warcraft III, as well as a super high quality Red Alert series by a well-known mapmaker. :D

I would like it if minions got their own gold from killing enemy minions and towers. That way I wouldn't have to selfishly worry about CSing, and instead focus more on objectives. 
Like, slaying Brambleback grants the bonus to all nearby friendly minions. And blue buff increases their attack rate and whatnot. 
Of course, the best would be Drake buffs. Imagine 3x winds. It'd be like having a whole army of little midget hecarims.
http://st.elohell.net/public/chill/f3d1ea1c23ae9b7976905a09f8d2b33f.jpg
Gimme that lightsaber cannon minion, awwww yeah.

I would play it
mehehehehehehe

Ughhhh... Dont make me miss Super Monday Night Combat more than I already do.

_Bouncers: Bouncers are large, gorilla-like bots that will chase and grapple enemy pros, like Pro's Grapples, their grapples can be avoided by jumping, although this will result into them charging into you and knocking you back, they can also punch Pros, dealing heavy damage. If you purchase a Bouncer, be sure to capitalise on any grapples they get buy attacking the immobile enemy. Kills from the Bouncer give cash to the player who bought it._

_JackBot XL: The JackBot XL is the largest bot SMNC has to offer, it has extremely hard hitting cannons on both hands and it can ground slam when an enemy Pro approaches. It has a humongous health pool and can take alot of punishment. However, they can be grappled and teamwork will easily take a Jackbot down, wasting your $4000. Thankfully, if a Jackbot is escorted, preferably by a Support to heal it, and a Cheston to use Bananas to break grapples on it, it can take down a turret or two before it gets taken down._

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=whyqXEp4N4c

I'm
I like game modes where the champions are the focal point.  I don't want to pour my gold into non player characters.

That said, if there was an rts style mode where you used item auras to help push and destroy waves or new banner of command type items to let you get involved, that would be cool.
